page.title: 11GROUPS AND SOCIETIES
page.content:
In the 1980s many people belonged to clubs, societies and groups devoted to all sorts of causes and objectives.
Professional Institutions served the interests of people pratising in fields such as medicine, the law, banking, engineering or commerce.
Protest Groups were set up to campaign against a wide variety of things including Nuclear Weapons, Animal Rights, and plans to dump radioactive waste at Elstow near Bedford.
Clubs and Societies for people who shared a common interest, such as a sport, arts or a hobby proliferated. Many of these served a vital social role because even in a period of rapidly devloping communications, loneliness was not unknown.
